title: Virgil van Dijk reacts to Pogba and De Gea missing Man Utd v Liverpool
text:
Virgil van Dijk has reacted to Paul Pogba and David de Gea missing Man Utd v Liverpool (Picture: Getty)

Virgil van Dijk admits it is ‘not ideal’ for Manchester United to lose Paul Pogba and David de Gea for their much-anticipated clash against Liverpool.

Both midfielder Pogba and goalkeeper De Gea have been ruled out of the Premier League showdown at Old Trafford on Sunday through injury.

Unbeaten Liverpool travel to the Theatre of Dreams boasting an eight-point gap at the top of the table. United, meanwhile, have won just two of their eight league fixtures this term.

French World Cup-winner Pogba is out with a foot injury (Picture: Getty)

Asked about United’s injury crisis, Van Dijk told Sky Sports: ‘For them, it is not the ideal situation to lose your first-choice goalkeeper, one of the best in the world, and one of their main midfielders.

‘They will be disappointed but for us, we just want to focus on ourselves.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘They want to bounce back for all they’ve done this season and it’s not what they’ve wanted so far, but we want to go out there and extend our points tally and keep winning.

‘They’re not in the best way, they’re not fully confident and they’re not in the situation they want to be in. But the good thing about football is you can bounce back in any game.

‘They might think this is the best occasion to bounce back from it but we know that. We want to go out and fight for every metre on the pitch and try and take the three points back to Liverpool.

‘It’s massive, but it’s more massive for the fans. I think all of the Champions League games are as big as this.

De Gea injured himself during the international break (Picture: Getty)

‘The whole atmosphere and leading to the actual game is bigger than some other games but I don’t think it’s the biggest of the season.

‘The big ones are the Champions League and the ones that are hopefully going to win us the Premier League title.’

Van Dijk has been one of the most impressive players in the Premier League since completing a £75million move to Liverpool in January 2018.

The Netherlands international has started 60 of the 61 games he has played for Liverpool and said: ‘I want to be involved in every game.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘They’re the most fun part of being a football player anyway, to go out there and show your talents to the world, try to win a game with a team you train with day in, day out.

‘It’s not easy, you need to look after yourself and with the life we live, it’s very important to leave a lot of things.

Van Dijk is one of Liverpool’s most important players (Picture: Getty)

‘For example, we play four games in the next 11 days, you’re travelling and staying in hotels and you need to watch what you eat, drink and make sure you recover well.

‘I’m not complaining, not at all, but you need to look after yourself because at the end of the day, the people are coming to the stadium to watch you play and it doesn’t matter if you had a cold the day before, they want you to turn up on matchday.

‘That’s why it’s very important to look after yourself and a big part of that is staying fit. Luckily, so far, I’ve been doing that pretty well and hopefully I can keep doing it.’

The PFA Players’ Player of the Year and UEFA Men’s Player of the Year added: ‘My role is the same with or without the armband.

Advertisement

‘I try to take responsibility because in my position, I have to and I want to as well.

‘I tried to lead the boys from behind and most of the time, I have an overview of the whole pitch so I can try to shout to the front three, whether they hear it or not.

‘Around me as well with the goalie, the full-backs, or the midfielders, I try to shout at them, whether it is nonsense or things that are necessary and need to be said.

‘I think it is a very important thing in football to keep each other awake and alert. Sometimes they have to shout it to me as well and they will.’

Ahead of the weekend, Liverpool have been boosted by the news Joel Matip will be fit to face Manchester United.
